Name.description: The Release Group's Name (Unlimited Translation Works)

Description.description: A short description about this release/version.

Common.DataSource.description: Available data sources to chose from.

ID.description: The image's ID, usually an int, but in the case of Static resources, it is the resource name.

RelativeFilepath.description:
The relative path from the base image directory. A client with access to the server's filesystem can map
these for quick access and no need for caching

Preferred.description: Is it marked as default. Only one default is possible for a given Shoko.Server.API.v3.Models.Common.Image.Type.

Disabled.description: Is it marked as disabled. You must explicitly ask for these, for obvious reasons.

MaxValue.description: out of what? Assuming int, as the max should be

Type.description: for temporary vs permanent, or any other situations that may arise later

Common.Rating.description: Rating object. Shared between sources, episodes vs series, etc

Language.description: Most will be Japanese. Once AniList is in, it will have multiple options

RoleDetails.description: Extra info about the role. For example, role can be voice actor, while role_details is Main Character

Common.SeriesRelation.description: Describes relations between two series entries.

ID.description: Tag id. Relative to it's source for now.

ParentID.description: The parent tag id, if any. Relative to it's source for now.

Description.description: What does the tag mean/what's it for.

IsVerified.description: True if the tag has been verified.

IsSpoiler.description: True if the tag is considered a spoiler for all series it appears on.

IsLocalSpoiler.description:
True if the tag is considered a spoiler for that particular series it is
set on.

Weight.description: How relevant is it to the series

LastUpdated.description: When the tag info was last updated.

Language.description: convert to AniDB style (x-jat is the special one, but most are standard 3-digit short names)

Default.description: If this is the default title

Common.Title.description:
Title object, stores the title, type, language, and source
if using a TvDB title, assume "eng:official". If using AniList, assume "x-jat:main"
AniDB's MainTitle is "x-jat:main"

MaxValue.description: Max allowed value for the user-submitted rating. Assumes 10 if not set.

Type.description: for temporary vs permanent, or any other situations that may arise later.

Common.Vote.description:
Vote object. Shared between sources, episodes vs series, etc.
Normalises the value

FileCount.description: Number of Files in the collection (visible to the current user)

SeriesCount.description: Number of Series in the Collection (visible to the current user)

GroupCount.description: The number of Groups in the Collection (visible to the current user)

FileSize.description: Total amount of space the collection takes (of what's visible to the current user)

WatchedHours.description: Watched Hours, rounded to one place

PercentDuplicate.description: The percentage of files that are either duplicates or belong to the same episode

MissingEpisodes.description: The Number of missing episodes, regardless of where they are from or available

MissingEpisodesCollecting.description: The number of missing episodes from groups we are collecting. This should not be used as a rule, as it's not very reliable

SeriesWithMissingLinks.description: The number of series missing both the TvDB and MovieDB Links

EpisodesWithMultipleFiles.description: The number of Episodes with more than one File (not marked as a variation)

FilesWithDuplicateLocations.description: The number of files that exist in more than one location

ResumePosition.description: Where to resume the next playback.

Watched.description: If the file/episode is considered watched.

Dashboard.EpisodeDetails.description: Episode details for displaying on the dashboard.

ID.description: The related Shoko.Server.API.v3.Models.Shoko.Episode.AniDB id for the entry.

Series.description: The related Shoko.Server.API.v3.Models.Shoko.Series.AniDB id for the entry.

ShokoFile.description:
The related Shoko Shoko.Server.API.v3.Models.Shoko.File id if a file is available
and/or appropriate.

ShokoEpisode.description:
The related Shoko Shoko.Server.API.v3.Models.Shoko.Episode id if the episode is
available locally.

ShokoSeries.description:
The related Shoko Shoko.Server.API.v3.Models.Shoko.Series id if the series is
available locally.

Dashboard.EpisodeDetailsIDs.description: Object holding ids related to the episode.

Web.description: ONAs and the like, it's more of a new concept

Other.description: Things marked on AniDB as Other, different from None

None.description: Series that don't have AniDB Records. This is very bad, and usually means there was an error in the import process. It can also happen if the API is hit at just the right time.

Unsafe.description: Run the action without checking if we're banned and what-not.

Payload.description: Extra payload to use with the action.

DebugController.AnidbUdpRequest.description: An abstraction for an AniDB UDP API Request.

DebugController.AnidbUdpResponse.description: A response from the AniDB UDP API.

AirDate.description: First Listed Air Date. This may not be when it aired, but an early release date

Episode.AniDB.description: AniDB specific data for an Episode

ParentSeries.description: The id of the parent Shoko.Server.API.v3.Models.Shoko.Series.

ID.description: The Shoko internal ID, for easy lookup

Season.description: Season Number, 0 is Specials. TvDB's Season system doesn't always make sense for anime, so don't count on it

Number.description: Episode Number in the Season. This is not Absolute Number

AbsoluteNumber.description: Absolute Episode Number. Keep in mind that due to reordering, this may not be accurate.

Title.description: Episode Title, in the language selected for TvDB. TvDB doesn't allow pulling more than one language at a time, so this isn't a list.

Description.description: Episode Description, in the language selected for TvDB. See Title for more info on Language.

AirDate.description: Air Date. Unfortunately, the TvDB air date doesn't necessarily conform to a specific timezone, so it can be a day off. If you see one that's wrong, please fix it on TvDB. You have the ID here in this model for easy lookup.

AirsAfterSeason.description: Mostly for specials. It shows when in the timeline the episode aired. I wouldn't count on it, as it's often blank.

AirsBeforeSeason.description: Mostly for specials. It shows when in the timeline the episode aired. I wouldn't count on it, as it's often blank.

AirsBeforeEpisode.description: Like AirsAfterSeason, it is for determining where in the timeline an episode airs. Also often blank.

ReleaseDate.description: The file's release date. This is probably not filled in

Version.description: The file's version, Usually 1, sometimes more when there are edits released later

IsDeprecated.description: Is the file marked as deprecated. Generally, yes if there's a V2, and this isn't it

IsCensored.description: Mostly applicable to hentai, but on occasion a TV release is censored enough to earn this.

OriginalFileName.description: The original FileName. Useful for when you obtained from a shady source or when you renamed it without thinking.

FileSize.description: The reported FileSize. If you got this far and it doesn't match, something very odd has occurred

Duration.description: The reported duration of the file

Description.description: Any comments that were added to the file, such as something wrong with it.

Chaptered.description: Does the file have chapters. This may be wrong, since it was only added in AVDump2 (a more recent version at that)

Updated.description: When we last got data on this file

AniDB.description: Any AniDB ID linked to this object

TvDB.description: Any TvDB IDs linked to this object

ResumePosition.description: Where to resume the next playback.

WatchedCount.description: Total number of times the file have been watched.

LastWatchedAt.description:
When the file was last watched. Will be null if the full is
currently marked as unwatched.

LastUpdatedAt.description: When the entry was last updated.

ImportFolderID.description: The Import Folder that this file resides in

RelativePath.description: The relative path from the import folder's path on the server. The Filename can be easily extracted from this. Using the ImportFolder, you can get the full server path of the file or map it if the client has remote access to the filesystem.

IsAccessible.description: Can the server access the file right now

ParentFilter.description: The Shoko.Server.API.v3.Models.Common.IDs.ID of the parent Shoko.Server.API.v3.Models.Shoko.Filter, if it has one.

ID.description: The Shoko internal ID, for easy lookup

IsInverted.description: Assumed Ascending unless this is specified. You must set this if you want highest rating, for example

Filter.SortingCriteria.description:
Sorting Criteria hold info on how Group Filters sort their items.
It is in a List to follow an OrderBy().ThenBy().ThenBy(), allowing
consistent results with fallbacks.

DefaultSeries.description:
The ID of the user selected default series, if it has one.
            
The value of this field will be reflected in Shoko.Server.API.v3.Models.Shoko.Group.GroupIDs.MainSeries if it is set.

MainSeries.description: The ID of the main series for the group.

ParentGroup.description: The ID of the direct parent group, if it has one.

TopLevelGroup.description:
The ID of the top-level (ancestor) group this group belongs to.
If the current group is a top-level group then it refers to
itself.

ID.description: The Shoko internal ID, for easy lookup

Name.description: The preferred series name for the user.

RevokeAPIKeys.description: Revoke all previous active API keys for the user.

ParentID.description:
The id of the parent filter. If you want to add/move this filter
as a sub-filter to an existing directory filter.

IsDirectory.description: Indicates the filter should be a directory filter.

IsInverted.description:
Indicates that the filter is inverted and all conditions applied
to it will be used to exclude groups and series instead of
include them.

IsHidden.description: Indicates the filter should be hidden unless explictly requested. This will hide the filter from the normal UIs.

ApplyAtSeriesLevel.description:
Inidcates the filter should be applied at the series level.
Filter conditions like like Seasons, Years, Tags, etc only count series individually, rather than by group.

Conditions.description: List of Conditions. Order doesn't matter.

Input.CreateOrUpdateFilterBody.description:
Used for creating new filters, updating existing filters, and/or
updating the live filter.

The Shoko.Server.API.v3.Models.Shoko.Group parent ID. Omit it or set it to 0 to
create a new top-level group.

SeriesIDs.description: All the series to put into the group.

ChildIDs.description: All groups to put into the group as sub-groups.

HasCustomName.description: Indicates the group should use a custom name.

HasCustomDescription.description: Indicates the group should use a custom description.

IsExternal.description: Not From MediaInfo. Is this an external sub file

TvDB Season. This value is not guaranteed to be even kind of accurate
TvDB matchings and links affect this. Null means no match. 0 means specials

Series.TvDB.description: The TvDB Data model for series

Shoko.description: The ID of the Shoko.Server.API.v3.Models.Shoko.Series entry.

SeriesSizes.EpisodeTypeCounts.description: Lists the count of each type of episode.

Progress.description: Out of 100, the progress percentage, if available

Blocked.description: Whether the system is blocked or not

Status.description: A message about the blocked state

ResumePosition.description:
Where to resume the next playback for the most recently watched file, if
any. Otherwise `null` if no files for the episode have any resume
positions.

Watched.description:
The last watched date and time for the current user for the most
recently watched file, if any. Or `null` if it is considered
"unwatched."

WatchCount.description:
Total number of times the episode have been watched (till completion) by
the user across all files.

IsHidden.description:
Episode is marked as "ignored." Which means it won't be show up in the
api unless explictly requested, and will not count against the unwatched
counts and missing counts for the series.

The Shoko.Server.API.v3.Models.Shoko.Episode.TvDB entries, if Shoko.Server.API.v3.Models.Common.DataSource.TvDB
is included in the data to add.

Name.description: The server's title. This will use overrides, the naming settings, MainTitle if all else fails. This is a guaranteed fallback

Size.description: number of direct children (number of series in group, eps in series, etc)

ID.description: The ID of the File. You'll need this to play it.

SeriesIDs.description:
The Cross Reference Models for every episode this file belongs to, created in a reverse tree and
transformed back into a tree. Series -> Episode such that only episodes that this file is linked to are
shown. In many cases, this will have arrays of 1 item

IsVariation.description: If this file is marked as a file variation.

Locations.description: All of the Locations that this file exists in

Resolution.description: Try to fit this file's resolution to something like 1080p, 480p, etc

ResumePosition.description: Where to resume the next playback.

Viewed.description:
The last time the current user viewed the file. Will be null if the user
have not viewed the file yet.

Watched.description:
The last time the current user watched the file until completion, or
otherwise marked the file was watched. Will be null if the user have not
watched the file yet.

Imported.description:
When the file was last imported. Usually is a file only imported once,
but there may be exceptions.

Created.description: The file creation date of this file

Updated.description: When the file was last updated (e.g. the hashes were added/updated).

IsLocked.description: Indicates the filter cannot be edited by a user.

IsDirectory.description: Indicates the filter should be a directory filter.

IsInverted.description:
Indicates that the filter is inverted and all conditions applied
to it will be used to exclude groups and series instead of
include them.

IsHidden.description: Indicates the filter should be hidden unless explictly requested. This will hide the filter from the normal UIs.

ApplyAtSeriesLevel.description:
Inidcates the filter should be applied at the series level.
Filter conditions like like Seasons, Years, Tags, etc only count series individually, rather than by group.

Conditions.description: List of Conditions. Order doesn't matter.

ExactMatch.description: Indicates whether the search result is an exact match to the query.

Index.description:
Represents the position of the match within the sanitized string.
This property is only applicable when ExactMatch is set to true.
A lower value indicates a match that occurs earlier in the string.

Distance.description:
Represents the similarity measure between the sanitized query and the sanitized matched result.
This may be the sorensen-dice distance or the tag weight when comparing tags for a series.
A lower value indicates a more similar match.

LengthDifference.description:
Represents the absolute difference in length between the sanitized query and the sanitized matched result.
A lower value indicates a match with a more similar length to the query.

Match.description: Contains the original matched substring from the original string.

tags.name: Debug
tags.description:
A controller with endpoints that should only be used while debugging.
Not for general use.

tags.name: Init
tags.description: The init controller. Use this for first time setup. Settings will also allow full control to the init user.

tags.name: ReverseTree
tags.description:
This Controller is intended to provide the reverse tree. It is used to get the series from episodes, etc.
This is to support filtering with Apply At Series Level and any other situations that might involve the need for it.

tags.name: Tree
tags.description:
This Controller is intended to provide the tree. An example would be "api/v3/filter/4/group/12/series".
This is to support filtering with Apply At Series Level and any other situations that might involve the need for it.
